briefdescription.para: status sub class to not compute the same structure twitce when not needed
Localisation sub class.

detaileddescription.para: Number of element used to extend the computational domain at each side of periodic boundary to accommodate for bubble evolution.

briefdescription.para: Global processor mapping: for each subdomain, which processor has it (indexed like this: mapping_(i, j, k))
Number of element in requested direction. If the current processor has an empty subdomain, the number of elements, nodes, faces is zero.

detaileddescription.para: indexing is nb_faces_local_[for orientation i][number of faces in direction j]

briefdescription.para: Number of nodes in requested direction. If the current processor has an empty subdomain, the number of elements, nodes, faces is zero.

MPI ranks of the processors that hold the neighbour domains. Indexing is neighbour_processors_[previous=0, next=1][direction]. Contains -1 if no neighbour. Wraps if periodic domain, if there is only one processor in a direction, the neighbour might be myself.

detaileddescription.para: Number of processors in each direction
Index in the global mesh of the first (non ghost) element on this processor, in each direction

briefdescription.para: Stores the periodic flag for each direction.
Where is this processor in the global domain (slice number in each direction, -1 if processor has no data)
Stores the uniform flag for each direction.

detaileddescription.para: Volume of each element on this processor
State of volume_elem_ on this processor

briefdescription.para: Mesh cell sizes for the entire mesh.

detaileddescription.para: The size of each array is equal to the total number of cells in each direction. If possible, this data is not computed from nodes (less truncation errors for uniform meshes)

briefdescription.para: Coordinates of all nodes (when cell size is needed, take delta_xyz_ which is more accurate) in directions i, j and k.

detaileddescription.para: We have: node_coordinates_xyz_.size() == 3 (3 directions in space) node_coordinates_xyz_[DIRECTION_I/J/K] == number of cells in direction i,j,k plus one The coordinate of the last node is the end coordinate of the mesh: if mesh is periodic, the last node coordinate is not equal to the first one.

briefdescription.para: F.

detaileddescription.para: For each direction, offsets of all slices

briefdescription.para: For each direction, size of all slices.
Returns the face according to the direction.

parameterdescription.para: In IJK, x(0), y(1) or z(2).

memberdef.name: get_independent_index

detaileddescription.para: independent_index adds a ghost_size to the packed index. It is similar to the linear_index defined in IJK_Field_local_template, but with a universal, predefined ghost_size of 256 instead of a field-dependent ghost_size. Since the ghost_size_ value is larger than any ghost_size expected to be used in practice, any virtual cell can be represented by the independent index.

briefdescription.para: Fills the "delta" array with the size of the cells owned by the processor in the requested direction.

detaileddescription.para: "delta" is redimensionned with the specified number of ghost cells and filled. If domain is periodic, takes periodic mesh size in ghost cells on first and last subdomain, if domain is not periodic, copy the size of the first and last cell into ghost cells in the walls.

parameterdescription.para: In IJK, x(0), y(1) or z(2).
Size of the ghost cells
Size of cells in each direction

briefdescription.para: Returns the position of the local subdomain in the requested direction.

parameterdescription.para: In IJK, x(0), y(1) or z(2)

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of element owned by this processor.
Returns the number of elements owned by this processor in the given direction.

parameterdescription.para: In IJK, x(0), y(1) or z(2)

briefdescription.para: Returns the total (global) number of mesh cells.
Returns the total (global) number of mesh cells in requested direction.

parameterdescription.para: In IJK, x(0), y(1) or z(2).

briefdescription.para: Returns the number, in requested direction, of faces that are oriented in direction of "compo".

detaileddescription.para: The last face of the last element is owned by the next processor.

parameterdescription.para: direction In IJK, horizontal(0), vertical(1) or z-axis depth(2)

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of nodes owned by this processor (generally equal to nb_elem_local())

detaileddescription.para: The last node of the last element is owned by the next processor.

parameterdescription.para: In IJK, x(0), y(1) or z(2)

briefdescription.para: Returns the index of the requested neighbour processor (-1 if no neighbour).

detaileddescription.para: previous_or_next = 0 => get processor at left (in the direction of smaller indices). previous_or_next = 1 => get processor at right (in the direction of the larger indices).

parameterdescription.para: 0 or 1, previous or next one respectively.
In IJK, x(0), y(1) or z(2).

memberdef.name: get_signed_independent_index

detaileddescription.para: signed_independent_index: encodes in the sign the phase of the cell in a two-phase flow: positive sign for phase 0, and negative sign for phase 1. With a cut-cell method, this can be used to disambiguate the sub-cell.

briefdescription.para: Builds the geometry, parallel splitting and DOF correspondance between a "father" region and a "son" region which is a subpart of the father region.

detaileddescription.para: Only conformal subregion is supported for now, with ELEMENT types. Missing features: be able to build a subregion which is the boundary of another, eg: father is "3D elements", son is "2D faces".

parameterdescription.para: Number of elements in direction(0)
Number of elements in direction(1)
Number of elements in direction(2)
Offset along x axis for the "son" subregion
Offset along x axis for the "son" subregion
Offset along x axis for the "son" subregion
Name of the "son" subregion
Whether if domain is periodic along x axis
Whether if domain is periodic along y axis
Whether if domain is periodic along z axis

para.verbatim: Only conformal subregion is supported for now, with ELEMENT types. Missing features: be able to build a subregion which is the boundary of another, eg: father is "3D elements", son is "2D faces".

memberdef.name: initialize_mapping

briefdescription.para: Creates a splitting of the domain by specifying the slice sizes and the processor mapping.

detaileddescription.para: The total cell number in directions i, j, and k must match the total number of cells in the whole geometry for each direction. The number of slices in each direction must match each corresponding dimensions of the mapping array. All processors do not have to be used!

parameterdescription.para: Contains for each slice in the i direction, the number of cells this slice.
Contains for each slice in the j direction, the number of cells this slice.
Contains for each slice in the k direction, the number of cells this slice.
Provides the rank of the mpi process that will own this subdomain.

para.verbatim: The total cell number in directions i, j, and k must match the total number of cells in the whole geometry for each direction. The number of slices in each direction must match each corresponding dimensions of the mapping array. All processors do not have to be used!

parameterdescription.para: Contains for each slice in the i direction, the number of cells this slice.
Contains for each slice in the j direction, the number of cells this slice.
Contains for each slice in the k direction, the number of cells this slice.
Provides the rank of the mpi process that will own this subdomain.

memberdef.name: initialize_splitting

briefdescription.para: Buils a splitting of the given deometry on the requested number of processors in each direction.

detaileddescription.para: Process_grouping allows to rearrange process ranks by packets of ni*nj*nk processes to matc the topology of the cluster/node. ex: 8 cores node/machine => use groups of size 2x2x2 to minimize extra-node messages.

parameterdescription.para: Number of processors in i direction.
Number of processors in j direction.
Number of processors in k direction.
1 by default. Number of processors per subdomain in i direction.
1 by default. Number of processors per subdomain in j direction.
1 by default. Number of processors per subdomain in k direction.

para.verbatim: Process_grouping allows to rearrange process ranks by packets of ni*nj*nk processes to matc the topology of the cluster/node. ex: 8 cores node/machine => use groups of size 2x2x2 to minimize extra-node messages.

parameterdescription.para: another domaine
Number of processors in i direction.

1 by default. Number of processors per subdomain in j direction.
1 by default. Number of processors per subdomain in k direction.

briefdescription.para: Creates a splitting of the domain by specifying the mapping.

para.verbatim: The total cell number in directions i,j,k must match the total number of cells in each direction. The number of slices in direction i, j , k must match dimensions 0,1 and 2 of the processor_mapping() array.

parameterdescription.para: Contains, for each slice in the x direction, the number of cells in this slice.
Contains, for each slice in the y direction, the number of cells in this slice.
Contains, for each slice in the z direction, the number of cells in this slice.
Provides the rank of the mpi process that will have this subdomain.
